case_title: AZIZULLAH KHAN ETC. vs Haji ABDUL JALIL AND ANOTHER

legal_basis.challenged_orders: Assistant Collector 1st Grade order dated 12-11-1973 rejecting extension for payment of court-fee
legal_basis.statute_cited: Section 148 of the Civil Procedure Code

key_findings.court_discretion: Court has discretion to extend time for payment of court-fee under Section 148 of CPC.
key_findings.jurisdiction_limit: Once discretion is exercised and order announced, court becomes functus officio.
key_findings.petitioner_fault: Petitioner failed to utilize the one-month time limit without sufficient cause.

advocate_for_petitioner: Mian Muhammad Younas Shah, Advocate, Peshawar
judgment_summary: The revision petitions were rejected in limine due to the petitioner's failure to provide sufficient cause for not availing the time limit for payment of court-fee arrears. Concurrent findings of lower courts were upheld.
